Microsoft has partnered with Fuzu - an online career development and employment platform - to bring you the Interns4Afrika program in response to demand from its software distribution and development partners across Africa. The program which was launched in 2016 aims to empower local communities by providing real employment opportunities to talented young professionals in Sales, Marketing and IT Technical Support within the Middle East and Africa thus, helping them build a better future for the continent. Through Fuzu, the aspiring young professionals will gain access open Microsoft roles under this program and apply for a chance to work on real projects in a dynamic and agile technology organization on the African continent.
JOB SUMMARY
Do not apply if:
- You are not a Kenyan citizen
- You have not completed your degree
- You are employed

Written communication, Verbal communication, Basic computer maintenance, Computer, laptop maintenance and repair, C, C# or C++, Database query languages (SQL, others), IT support, Customer support, CRM systems, Problem solving, Troubleshooting

Bachelor's degree

ABOUT THE COMPANY
SafeBoda is a community of entrepreneurs and boda drivers working together to improve professional standards across the urban transportation industry in Africa. Our aim is to improve the industry for both drivers and passengers by increasing the number of safe trips taken per day and by making travel around cities convenient and stress-free
JOB SUMMARY
At the click of a button, SafeBoda provides a safe, more convenient, mobile-first transportation platform for Africa’s booming young population. On the high-frequency use of our transportation service, SafeBoda is providing value to consumers, our drivers, and passengers, with additional financial services, payments, and other on-demand services to keep Africa moving forward. 
Based in Nairobi, Kampala, and Barcelona, we are a venture-funded company that is already having a huge impact on millions of people in East Africa.
SafeBoda is looking for a Head of Business Intelligence & Analytics. As the most senior data analyst in the organisation, you’ll take an active role in shaping the way that SafeBoda uses data science and analytics to shape our products and services . You will build a team that interacts with product, operations, marketing and finance to propose insights, build and monitor KPIs, develop experiments, and deploy models that help enhance and grow SafeBoda!
The ideal candidate is an experienced data-driven business person with strong data analytical and business strategy experience. This means having a structured hypothesis driven problem solving skills and an experimental, start-up mentality. The ideal candidate will have experience in working with and rolling out BI systems, is equally comfortable writing a complex SQL query with presenting findings to the C Suite and should be passionate about growing and managing a young team. 
You will work closely with the senior management of the company and will play a pivotal role in shaping the company’s future. 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead BI, Data Science and Analytics across the organisation and build a team to drive this work. Ensure that all departments are using data and insights to inform their strategy. 
Coach and manage a team of data analysts and data scientists. 
Manage the roll out of BI tools to ensure we have world class dashboards and analytics software.
Ensure that the day to day data needs of the entire organisation is met including reporting pipelines, dashboards. 
Identify key market-level questions and hypotheses and own the data analysis needed to test and answer these questions
Design, run and analyze experiments to scale and improve performance in different departments of SafeBoda. 
Develop a culture of data driven decisions at all levels at SafeBoda
You should have
A graduate degree or equivalent in a quantitative field such as engineering, math or statistics, or MBA
+8 years of professional experience including BI, investment banking, consulting, data science, tech or a start-up. The ideal candidate would have at least 5 years experience using data to solve real-world, large-scale problems. 
Prior management and team-building experience necessary. You will have the opportunity to scale, build and develop a team of analysts and data scientists. 
Proven business strategy and consulting experience - you have the ability to navigate ambiguity, juggle multiple tasks, think independently and problem solve in a structured manner. 
Data analytics expertise with a passion for quantitative analysis. Knowledge of software packages for data analysis is a plus. Be an excel whizz and comfortable modelling and manipulating data. 
Proven ability to work well across different teams and get things done. 
Live the SafeBoda values, represent the company in everything you do and constantly fly the flag. 
Benefits
Scale with a rapidly growing startup, with tons of opportunity for growth and impact
Contribute to our mission and work at our dynamic and fast-paced company in Africa
Competitive salary based on experience 
Free SafeBoda transport
Free lunch every day

Performance monitoring and evaluation, Analytics, Business intelligence, Team leadership, Hypothesis formulation, Data analysis
REQUIRED EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree

ABOUT THE COMPANY
At Lynk we make it easier for households and businesses to connect with high quality professionals. Currently we have verified professionals in over 70 categories ranging from cleaners, to masseuses, to plumbers, and tailors. Through the use of technology we unlock important career tools such as digital profiles, product galleries, customer reviews, and more.
JOB SUMMARY
Lynk is a startup which builds technology to connect blue collar workers in Kenya - from carpenters to cleaners - to jobs. Our suite of products seeks to satisfy a breadth of consumer needs, which provide multiple channels to increase incomes for workers in our system:
Lynk Requests: A marketplace product enabling customers to request services in over 50 categories from cleaners, to masseuses, to plumbers, and tailors, and receive shortlisted bids.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Our mission is to help people who need it the most with the thing we love most: building sustainable software. We are realizing this in two ways: by building impact software and by creating jobs fair trade-style. Giving bright young developers a fair and educational job. This is our mission. They will be working together in one team, with one shared goal where collaboration is key. Together with developers in the Netherlands we will be creating the coolest solutions for the coolest companies! Software where knowledge is shared and fair jobs are created.
JOB SUMMARY
Incentro:
Listen to this: we believe happy people deliver excellent results. This is why we exist, to create a working environment where our staff can do what they were born to do: create software that makes impact. We are a Google Premier partner in Kenya. We support innovative companies to become more productive and utilize the power of the cloud. We also build interesting web/app solutions for the Dutch and Kenyan market either commissioned by our customers or our own solutions in interesting partnerships. 
We manage this by being transparent, honest and giving full responsibility to our colleagues. We celebrate success and understand that in order to succeed, you need to be allowed to fail as well. By doing this, we already opened 6 offices in the Netherlands and Spain with almost 300 happy employees and 130+ happy customers.
Do you want to pursue happiness with us? Join us now!
Profile Summary:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, ambitious young developer with 1 to 3 years of work experience in the work of infrastructure, cloud solutions, back-end development. Someone who likes to work in a complex environment with inspiring colleagues, inspiring clients and lots of learning opportunities. 
With your ambitions and drive you bring energy and inspiration to the team. You will assist in customer engagement, and build a close relationship with both our team in Nairobi and also with our specialists in the Netherlands.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Role:
● You will be part of a team for our office in Nairobi that delivers great Google Cloud solutions.
● You will discuss our products with our local and dutch specialists and work towards the best possible solutions.
● You are all rounded and able to development and implementation of Google Cloud solutions together with our local and dutch certified Google consultants.
● You will implement and consult existing and new Google Cloud customers
● You will be working in a team of experts to deploy applications to App Engine or Compute Engine in Google Cloud Platform.
You need to bring:
● Good understanding of how domain registration and web hosting works.
● Good understanding and experience in any back-end languages and frameworks such asPhp, Python, Java and MEAN.js,
● You are able to collaborate on code using version control systems, such as Git.
● Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.
● You understand how networks and email services work have and are familiar with their protocols like SMTP, DNS, etc.
● Previous experience with working in an Agile team would be a great advantage!
● Understanding of cloud platforms, and how to operate in them, would be a big plus!
● Experience with Google Cloud Platform (Big Plus) for a few months, 1 or 2 years
Besides knowledge we are looking for the following competencies:
● Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a developer (both front-end and back-end), network engineer, technical support
● Minimum a Bachelor's degree in relevant areas e.g. ICT, Computer Science, web design, Statistics etc.
● Strong English written and oral communication skills and are not scared of discussing possible solutions with customers.
● Cultural awareness and the ability to work with Western management.
● Entrepreneurial spirit, willing to assist in a growing office.
● Energized and passionate about all you do in life.
● Flexible, open for new challenges and able to think out of the box.
● Responsible for finishing the work on time.
● Real team player who works together with other specialists in order to create the best result.
● Your assertive attitude enables you to collaborate remotely in a virtual team.
We offer you:
● The opportunity to train and become a Google certified expert either in Professional Cloud Architect, Associate Cloud Engineer, Professional Data Engineer, Professional Cloud Developer 
● Healthcare and a healthy lunch at the office
● Working with and receiving training and coaching from some of the best developers in Kenya and Netherlands.
● Working in an agile environment with little hierarchy and lots of growing opportunities with a great focus on employee happiness.
● Great employment opportunity with room for creativity and development of your own career. In the Netherlands we were awarded the ‘Best Place to Work - Award’ in 2017 and 2018.
● A competitive salary
● Being part of the first Google Cloud certified team that delivers amazing solutions in Kenya

ABOUT THE COMPANY
The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) is a membership Union uniquely composed of both government and civil society organisations. It provides public, private and non-governmental organisations with the knowledge and tools that enable human progress, economic development and nature conservation to take place together.
JOB SUMMARY
The “participatory assessment of land degradation and sustainable land management in grassland and pastoral areas” is a global project funded by the Global Environment Facility (GEF) and implemented by the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) and executed by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) through the government partners in Burkina Faso, Kenya, Kyrgyzstan, Niger and Uruguay. The project aims to produce and test a methodology for the participatory assessment and monitoring of land degradation in pastoral areas. The project has two overall objective, i) to strengthen the capacity of local and national stakeholders in pastoral areas comprising of grasslands and rangelands to assess land degradation and ii) to inform decisions to promote Sustainable Land Management (SLM) in a way that preserves the diverse ecosystem goods and services provided by rangelands and grasslands. The project has three inter‐related components: 
1. Development of a participatory assessment and monitoring system for pastoral areas, comprising of grassland and rangeland. 
2. Inform international and national pastoral decision‐making processes based on the results and best practices from the participatory pastoral areas assessments. 
3. Knowledge management, communications, monitoring and evaluation of the project. Central to the first and the second project component is the importance of consolidating secondary baseline data and landscape‐scale assessment through remote sensing imagery to support rangeland and grassland assessment with communities. 
Deliverables • Short (2‐4 page) inception report outlining the approach that will be followed and describing the final products • A mock‐up of the proposed website/data‐platform presented to IUCN and partners for comment • A finished and fully‐operational online website/data‐platform handed over to IUCN • A brief final report on the task, including recommendations on improving interactive functionality and on incorporating additional data sets 
RESPONSIBILITIES
The purpose of this consultancy is to establish an online platform for data management and access and to populate with data from the Kenya baseline studies and field assessment, conducted in 2018‐19.
1. All project data is to be stored and publically available in an online database, which will include a mechanism to provide permission or registration so that IUCN can monitor downloads 
2. Key project analyses will be visible through a website, with an independent domain‐name, which may be a static visualization of key findings, but which will be useable by government decision‐makers and others to inform landscape planning 
3. The website will include some functionality that could later allow a more interactive use of data, and the consultant should provide advice on how such interaction will work 
4. The database and website will allow for the addition of data from the other 4 countries when the data is available, which means the site must be accessible and useable by project partners from other countries
REQUIRED SKILLS
Project management, Reporting, Software architecture, Database administration
REQUIRED EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree
